columns.text: In this exercise, we are tasked with researching additional information on a bond issued by Coca-Cola.

First, we will clarify the **information** we need to research on the site presented in the exercise text.

**Credit rating** of a bond is a classification, given by the bond grading services like Moody's or *Standard and Poor's*, which indicates the bond's credit quality.

The  **size of the bond issue** is the total value of all bonds issued, that is, the number of bonds issued multiplied by the par value (also called face value). 

The **yield to maturity** indicates the total return anticipated at the time the bond matures.

The **price of the bond when issued** is the original price of the bond.

To solve this exercise, we will navigate to the web page introduced in the exercise text.

There, we can **search** for the bond. It is best for us to search by the bond's **CUSIP number**.

**CUSIP number** serves as a unique identifier for securities in North America and is used for the purposes of facilitating the clearing and settlement of trades.

The CUSIP number of our bond can be found in the figure presented in the exercise text.

When we have found our bond, we will be presented with a page containing all information on the bond, with additional charts of the price and yield changes over time.

In case the information is not presented directly on the page, we can always click on the **prospectus** link.

There we can download the whole prospectus of this bond.

The **prospectus** is a legal document containing all the necessary key legal and financial information of the bond and the company offering the bond.
